meanings.definition: The quality or state of not being applicable.
meanings.sent1: The inapplicability of the old rules caused confusion.
meanings.sent2: The inapplicability of his advice to the situation was evident.
meanings.sent3: The inapplicability of wearing a swimsuit in the snow made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The inapplicability of using a hammer to fix a computer is like using a spoon to dig a hole.
meanings.sent5: The inapplicability of a bicycle in the ocean is as clear as day.

meanings.definition: The lack of relevance or suitability.
meanings.sent1: The inapplicability of her outdated knowledge was apparent.
meanings.sent2: The inapplicability of his jokes to the serious meeting was awkward.
meanings.sent3: The inapplicability of wearing a winter coat in the desert would be quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The inapplicability of a broken compass in a maze is like having no compass at all.
meanings.sent5: The inapplicability of a flashlight in broad daylight is hard to miss.
